tweet: I extend my deepest condolences to his family, friends, and colleagues, and am reminded yet again of the incredible service and sacrifice of our law enforcement professionals.

I am deeply saddened that yet another Illinois State Trooper was killed today in the line of duty in an accident with a wrong-way driver. Trooper Gerald Ellis lost his life serving our communities and protecting other motorists from harm. https://twitter.com/chicagotribune/status/1111999162596364288 …

During #TransVisibilityWeek, we’ve displayed this flag outside our office door as a sign of support for the transgender community. We stand with you fighting for equality, dignity, and respect. pic.twitter.com/ZwmWuGfGO5

President Trump's discriminatory ban on transgender members of our military is rooted in prejudice, not the facts of military readiness. I voted today to oppose this policy and support the many transgender troops currently serving with honor. https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/house-votes-to-condemn-trump-ban-on-transgender-military-service/2019/03/28/fa1b6056-515b-11e9-8d28-f5149e5a2fda_story.html?utm_term=.807bb930110a …

This is a step toward long overdue justice for our Vietnam Veterans. If you are a veteran who needs help with the Department of Veterans Affairs, we have caseworkers in our district office available to help. Please get in touch at (847) 383-4870. https://www.militarytimes.com/news/pentagon-congress/2019/03/26/va-recommends-dropping-legal-challenge-over-blue-water-navy-veterans-benefits …

It’s 2019 and a woman still makes, on average, 80 cents for every dollar earned by a man. Today, I voted to help end gender-based wage discrimination by passing the Paycheck Fairness Act. I'm committed to closing the gender pay gap.  #EqualPayForEqualWork pic.twitter.com/1GINxlyHTX

From a church in SC to a synagogue in PA, we have too many tragic examples of the dangers of domestic terrorism. The tragedy in New Zealand shows the vile ideology is growing beyond our borders too. Our bill is a necessary first step to help our law enforcement contain threat.

It’s time we update our laws to reflect the growing threat of domestic terror. In the last decade, white supremacists and other violent far-right extremists have been responsible for more deaths than any other category. Proud to again partner with @SenatorDurbin on this bill. https://twitter.com/NewsHour/status/1110991326324101120 …

I'm a co-sponsor of #HR9 to return the US to the Paris Climate Agreement & meet our emission reduction commitments. Climate change is a threat to our future. We need to seize the opportunity to foster American innovation & create good-paying clean energy jobs. #ClimateActionNow
This is about American's health, not scoring political points. It's way past time to move past this debate and start working together to build on the successes of #ACA and fix what isn't working.

Unbelievable that the Trump Administration still continues to work to sabotage and strike down the #ACA, including important provisions like protecting coverage for pre-existing conditions and allowing young people to remain on a parent's health insurance until age 26. https://twitter.com/CNN/status/1110705509500403713 …

Appalling that a Member of Congress would quote Mein Kampf anywhere, anytime, but especially from the House chamber. I have a rule: unless you're talking about Hitler and Nazis, don’t bring up Hitler or Nazis. That's true whether you are a Republican or a Democrat. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1110492565902635013 …
We also talked about my new bipartisan resolution reaffirming Congress’s support for a two-state solution and opposition to the Global BDS Movement that pushes peace further out of reach.
I was glad to meet today with folks from home attending the @AIPAC Policy Conference in DC to discuss my continued support for a strong US-Israel relationship. pic.twitter.com/gOUhglQiJq

I spoke on the House Floor recognizing Medal of Honor Day and Sgt. James Lynch of Gurnee, one of just 72 living recipients of our nation's highest military honor. #MedalofHonorDay pic.twitter.com/3pdRIHSGZg
I was glad to be at the announcement event, and also to get interviewed by some student members of the press corps! pic.twitter.com/DoTZYhF8nO

A highlight of last week's district work period was the huge announcement of a $40 million donation by @abbvie to rebuild Neal Math and Science Academy in North Chicago. The new facility will improve student success, including more opportunities to gain important #STEM skills. https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1109080082218475520 …

The American people deserve the facts on foreign interference in the 2016 election, and they deserve to read Mueller’s report for themselves, not just the hastily prepared 4 page letter from the President’s Attorney General. #ReleaseTheReport https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1110531346865274880 …

The American people deserve the truth on foreign interference in the 2016 election. It’s critical for the health of our democracy that the #MuellerReport and its findings are released to Congress and the public as soon as possible.

Great to visit with the team at K-Log, a family-owned furniture retailer in Zion, and hear their perspective on the challenges and opportunities facing small businesses. #BradAtYourBusiness pic.twitter.com/YFeiUstOWZ
We closed off our day of school visits with a town hall answering student questions at Lake Forest College. @LFCollege pic.twitter.com/rzUY3Aq98N
Talking with students studying Civics at New Trier High School (@newtrier203) during our day of local school visits. pic.twitter.com/phBnOXSxy0

It was great to visit TRI Industries in Vernon Hills, which remanufactures toner cartridges, and meet their team. TRI has a strong commitment to hiring veterans and individuals with disabilities. pic.twitter.com/sMuvZ3cmhu

It was heartening to be with community members of different faith backgrounds at a vigil in Mt. Prospect in remembrance of the 50 Muslim worshipers murdered in New Zealand. Hate can only be defeated when good people come together & stand up to call it out. https://wgntv.com/2019/03/17/across-chicago-area-vigils-honor-victims-of-new-zealand-terror-attacks/ …

Many of our Vietnam Veterans did not receive the recognition they deserved when they returned home. It was a true privilege to recognize the Vietnam Veterans in our community at a @vietnamwar50th event in Libertyville and offer a long overdue thank you for their service. pic.twitter.com/S4gmLMlLxK
I visited with seniors in Fox Lake  over the weekend, helping serve lunch and answering some questions. Thank you to Mayor Donny Schmit for the invite! pic.twitter.com/cM4Hp8zKwB

It was wonderful to visit Misericordia @heartofmercy and talk with the residents & staff. I also met with families from #IL10 to discuss how we can maximize potential and opportunities for Americans with developmental disabilities. pic.twitter.com/SHVdIzLiAx

Thank you to Northeastern Illinois Agency on Aging (@Agency_On_Aging) for inviting me to participate on the discussion this morning on reducing social isolation for our seniors. pic.twitter.com/Z26YCqriz1

I am horrified and heartbroken by the terrorist attack against the Muslim community of New Zealand. We stand with you against hate and condemn the vile ideology of white supremacy that motivated this attack.

Anyone who puts on the uniform to defend our nation deserves our gratitude, not prejudice. The Trump Administration's new restrictions are discriminatory and disrespect the thousands of transgender troops currently serving with honor. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/military-to-begin-enforcing-restrictions-on-trumps-transgender-troops/2019/03/13/cf2a0530-4587-11e9-9726-50f151ab44b9_story.html …

No American should face legal discrimination because of who they are or who they love. I’m proud to join with my colleagues to again introduce the #EqualityAct, to ensure the federal civil rights protections are available to all #LGBTQ Americans. pic.twitter.com/sVCzDLPmmp

An open internet is too important to our economy and society to allow regulations to see-saw back and forth with each new Administration. I hope we will continue to build on this progress with lasting legislation to make net neutrality the law of the land. #SaveTheNet

I'm proud to co-sponsor this legislation to restore #NetNeutrality. It’s vital the Internet remain open, accessible, and uncensored for all. https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/democrats-unveil-save-internet-act-restore-net-neutrality-laws-n980051 …
Happy Birthday to the @girlscouts! https://twitter.com/NASASTEM/status/1105455562538524674 …

DREAMers are essential parts of our communities and American in every way that counts. I'm proud to help introduce H.R. 6, the Dream & Promise Act. It's time we take action to #ProtecttheDream. pic.twitter.com/oYSd0H8F4w
Thanks everyone who came out this morning to talk with @SenatorDurbin and me at our Congress on Your Corner in Zion! pic.twitter.com/W2lK3OeGwC
Getting ready to vote on #HR1 the #ForthePeople Act to restrict the influence of dark money in campaigns, expand voting rights protections, and strengthen ethics rules. pic.twitter.com/LMc6MEeXJe

On #InternationalWomensDay, we celebrate the path-breaking women who led the way to the progress we enjoy today, and recommit ourselves to fighting for full gender equality. I will continue to work to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act #VAWA & pass #PaycheckFairnessAct. pic.twitter.com/4bxS2MRfOY

I wrote in @CNN with @RepElaineLuria and @RepJoshG about the pernicious claim of dual loyalty and why it has no place in our policy debates. https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/07/opinions/why-as-members-of-congress-we-must-call-out-rep-omars-comments-schneider-luria-gottheimer/index.html …

The EPA's reluctance to conduct ambient air monitoring of Ethylene Oxide in Lake County is unacceptable. This is about the health of our communities, and we need to get the facts. I will be continuing to push the EPA to begin this urgently needed testing as soon as possible. https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1101600107135451139 …
